metadata.name: Potentially Suspicious CMD Shell Output Redirect
metadata.comment: Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location. This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\cmd.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('cmd.exe') AND (lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.%appdata%\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.%temp%\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.%tmp%\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.%userprofile%\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.c:\\\\programdata\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.c:\\\\temp\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.c:\\\\users\\\\public\\\\.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*>.c:\\\\windows\\\\temp\\\\.*' OR (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' >')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('">')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('''>'))) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('c:\\\\users\\\\')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('\\\\appdata\\\\local\\\\'))))

output.summary: Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location. This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate admin or third party scripts used for diagnostic collection might generate some false positives Reference: https://thedfirreport.com/2022/07/11/select-xmrig-from-sqlserver/
